page.title: 16ELECTRICITY AND WATER
page.content: {1945 They wired houses for electricity in 1935, but not for everybody. During the war there was a blackout - no lights showing at night. The lavatory was outside and did not flush until 1950. They had taps but not hot. They heated the water in an old fashioned boiler over a fire. {1965 They had inside lavatories, bathrooms and taps with hot and cold. Most houses had electricity and there were electric street lights. {1985 We have inside lavatories, bathrooms and showers. Our taps have hot and cold. We heat our water with immersion heaters, boilers and Agas. We can have a bath when we want and use washing machines, tumble driers and dishwashers. We all have electricity.
